"Through these ritualistic practices I feel a sense of glow within. And so I learn to glow up in a very mindful way and when I feel good from the inside out it affects everything in my life."
After 8 weeks of meditating, people had more gray matter in their brains.
- Harvard scientists

Bosnak finds that meditation is especially necessary in this modern age. "It is an incredible way to slow down the chattering mind, the monkey mind, and to really understand the possibility that lives within you," she says. "The process of meditating helps you to truly wake up." If you're ready to take her call to action to "just start" try carving out 15 to 20 minutes each day. "It takes about that long for your mind to calm down," she explains, noting that she loves to use essential oils to aid this process. "I like to use lavender essential oil because the scent is so calming and it helps students to really go inwards and stimulate their senses," she says.

After 8 weeks of meditating, peopleâ€™s brains actually changed for the better.
- Harvard scientists
